Sure, here are a few recommendations for places to visit in the Scottish Borders:

1. Abbotsford House - this is the former home of famous author Sir Walter Scott and is now a museum with exhibits on his life and work.

2. Melrose Abbey - a ruined 12th-century abbey that is one of the most important medieval sites in Scotland.

3. The Three Brethren - a group of three hilltop cairns that offer stunning panoramic views of the Borders countryside.

4. Floors Castle - a stunning French-style chateau that is the largest inhabited castle in Scotland and has beautiful gardens.

5. Tweed Valley - a picturesque valley that is home to several charming towns and villages, including Peebles, Innerleithen and Galashiels.

6. St Abb's Head National Nature Reserve - a seaside nature reserve with dramatic cliffs, seabirds and incredible views.

7. Jedburgh Abbey - a ruined Augustinian abbey that dates back to the 12th century and is one of the most impressive historic sites in the Borders.

8. Traquair House - a historic house that dates back to 1107 and is Scotland's oldest inhabited house.

These are just a few of the many wonderful places to visit in the Scottish Borders – there are plenty of other charming towns, historical sites, and natural wonders to explore!
